body: That actually makes sense, since the position is only relevant in the context of a specific instance of FileSource.

This issue is still labeled as `status:team discussion`. Personally I don't mind ignoring that to speed things along at the risk of some rework. But @lslonina in https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/4629#issuecomment-2948855280 commented that he's waiting for the team discussion to be done.

Would it be possible to move this ahead so we can get it into v5 and/or v6?

rename.from: High overhead in FileSource due to repeated canonical path resolution during test discovery
rename.to: High overhead in `FileSource` due to repeated canonical path resolution

body:
> An interesting case for when there are many test positions per file.
> 
> Perhaps, a non-static factory in `FileSource` would also work?
> 
> ```java
> 	public FileSource withPosition(FilePosition position) {
> 		Preconditions.notNull(position, "position must not be null");
> 		return direct(file, position); // new FileSource without canonicalPath call
> 	}
> ```

I was literally going to suggest exactly that!

But then I read the comments, and you'd already made the suggestion. ðŸ˜Ž 

I see no reason not to introduce that right away, and I'm also fine with including this in `5.x`.
@sbrannen There's already an open PR that introduces that: #4629
**Team decision:** Go with the proposal from https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/4630#issuecomment-3279151335

issue.title: Add `withPosition(FilePosition)` method to `FileSource`

repository.name: junit-framework

issue.body:

- Introduced internal factory methods for clearer construction paths
